metadata.title: Representing Time Spans with Duration
metadata.summary: Use Duration to represent time intervals in a type-safe, human-readable, and composable way.

metadata.title: Combining Values with zip
metadata.summary: Use zip to combine two computations, pairing their results together in Effect, Stream, Option, or Either.

metadata.title: Handle Errors with catchTag, catchTags, and catchAll
metadata.summary: Use catchTag for type-safe recovery from specific tagged errors, and catchAll to recover from any possible failure.

metadata.title: Handle Unexpected Errors by Inspecting the Cause
metadata.summary: Use Effect.catchAllCause or Effect.runFork to inspect the Cause of a failure, distinguishing between expected errors (Fail) and unexpected defects (Die).

metadata.title: Use Chunk for High-Performance Collections
metadata.summary: Use Chunk<A> as a high-performance, immutable alternative to JavaScript's Array, especially for data processing pipelines.

metadata.title: Mapping Errors to Fit Your Domain
metadata.summary: Use Effect.mapError to transform specific, low-level errors into more general domain errors, creating clean architectural boundaries.

metadata.title: Creating from Synchronous and Callback Code
metadata.summary: Use sync and async to lift synchronous or callback-based computations into Effect, enabling safe and composable interop with legacy code.

metadata.title: Model Optional Values Safely with Option
metadata.summary: Use Option<A> to explicitly represent a value that may or may not exist, eliminating null and undefined errors.

metadata.title: Validate Request Body
metadata.summary: Safely parse and validate an incoming JSON request body against a predefined Schema.

metadata.title: Control Repetition with Schedule
metadata.summary: Use Schedule to create composable, stateful policies that define precisely how an effect should be repeated or retried.

metadata.title: Organize Layers into Composable Modules
metadata.summary: Structure a large application by grouping related services into 'module' layers, which are then composed together with a shared base layer.

metadata.title: Supercharge Your Editor with the Effect LSP
metadata.summary: Install the Effect Language Server (LSP) extension for your editor to get rich, inline type information and enhanced error checking for your Effect code.

metadata.title: Model Optional Values Safely with Option
metadata.summary: Use Option<A> to explicitly represent a value that may or may not exist, eliminating null and undefined errors.

metadata.title: Instrument and Observe Function Calls with Effect.fn
metadata.summary: Use Effect.fn to wrap, instrument, and observe function calls, enabling composable logging, metrics, and tracing at function boundaries.

metadata.title: Comparing Data by Value with Structural Equality
metadata.summary: Use Data.struct and Equal.equals to safely compare objects by their value instead of their reference, avoiding common JavaScript pitfalls.

metadata.title: Leverage Effect's Built-in Structured Logging
metadata.summary: Use Effect's built-in logging functions for structured, configurable, and context-aware logging.

metadata.title: Add Caching by Wrapping a Layer
metadata.summary: Implement caching by creating a new layer that wraps a live service, intercepting method calls to add caching logic without modifying the original service.

metadata.title: Add Custom Metrics to Your Application
metadata.summary: Use Effect's Metric module to instrument your code with counters, gauges, and histograms to track key business and performance indicators.

metadata.title: Race Concurrent Effects for the Fastest Result
metadata.summary: Use Effect.race to run multiple effects concurrently and proceed with the result of the one that succeeds first, automatically interrupting the others.

metadata.title: Use Effect.gen for Business Logic
metadata.summary: Encapsulate sequential business logic, control flow, and dependency access within Effect.gen for improved readability and maintainability.

metadata.title: Work with Immutable Sets using HashSet
metadata.summary: Use HashSet<A> to model immutable, high-performance sets for efficient membership checks and set operations.

metadata.title: Transform Data During Validation with Schema
metadata.summary: Use Schema.transform to safely convert data from one type to another during the parsing phase, such as from a string to a Date.

metadata.title: Pattern Match on Option and Either
metadata.summary: Use declarative match() combinators to handle optional and error-prone values

metadata.title: Manage Resource Lifecycles with Scope
metadata.summary: Use Scope for fine-grained, manual control over resource lifecycles, ensuring cleanup logic (finalizers) is always executed.

metadata.title: Sequencing with andThen, tap, and flatten
metadata.summary: Use andThen, tap, and flatten to sequence computations, run side effects, and flatten nested structures in Effect, Stream, Option, and Either.

metadata.title: Safely Bracket Resource Usage with `acquireRelease`
metadata.summary: Use `Effect.acquireRelease` to guarantee a resource's cleanup logic runs, even if errors or interruptions occur.

metadata.title: Create a Stream from a List
metadata.summary: Turn a simple in-memory array or list into a foundational data pipeline using Stream.

metadata.title: Turn a Paginated API into a Single Stream
metadata.summary: Convert a paginated API into a continuous, easy-to-use stream, abstracting away the complexity of fetching page by page.

metadata.title: Accumulate Multiple Errors with Either
metadata.summary: Use Either<E, A> to represent computations that can fail, allowing you to accumulate multiple errors instead of short-circuiting on the first one.

metadata.title: Handling Errors with catchAll, orElse, and match
metadata.summary: Use catchAll, orElse, and match to recover from errors, provide fallbacks, or transform errors in Effect, Either, and Option.

metadata.title: Access Configuration from the Context
metadata.summary: Access your type-safe configuration within an Effect.gen block by yielding the Config object you defined.

metadata.title: Teach your AI Agents Effect with the MCP Server
metadata.summary: Use the Effect MCP server to provide live, contextual information about your application's structure directly to AI coding agents.

metadata.title: Redact and Handle Sensitive Data
metadata.summary: Use Redacted to securely handle sensitive data, ensuring secrets are not accidentally logged or exposed.

metadata.title: Define Type-Safe Errors with Data.TaggedError
metadata.summary: Create custom, type-safe error classes by extending Data.TaggedError to make error handling robust, predictable, and self-documenting.

metadata.title: Handle a GET Request
metadata.summary: Define a route that responds to a specific HTTP GET request path.

metadata.title: Process Items Concurrently
metadata.summary: Perform an asynchronous action for each item in a stream with controlled parallelism to dramatically improve performance.

metadata.title: Accessing the Current Time with Clock
metadata.summary: Use the Clock service to access the current time in a testable, deterministic way, avoiding direct calls to Date.now().

metadata.title: Process Items in Batches
metadata.summary: Group items into chunks for efficient bulk operations, like database inserts or batch API calls.

metadata.title: Execute Synchronous Effects with Effect.runSync
metadata.summary: Use Effect.runSync at the 'end of the world' to execute a purely synchronous Effect and get its value directly.

metadata.title: Lifting Values with succeed, some, and right
metadata.summary: Use succeed, some, and right to lift plain values into Effect, Option, or Either, making them composable and type-safe.

metadata.title: Add Custom Metrics to Your Application
metadata.summary: Use Effect's Metric module to instrument your code with counters, gauges, and histograms to track key business and performance indicators.

metadata.title: Provide Dependencies to Routes
metadata.summary: Inject services like database connections into HTTP route handlers using Layer and Effect.Service.

metadata.title: Execute Asynchronous Effects with Effect.runPromise
metadata.summary: Use Effect.runPromise at the 'end of the world' to execute an asynchronous Effect and get its result as a JavaScript Promise.

metadata.title: Send a JSON Response
metadata.summary: Create and send a structured JSON response with the correct headers and status code.

metadata.title: Modeling Effect Results with Exit
metadata.summary: Use Exit<E, A> to represent the result of running an Effect, capturing both success and failure (including defects) in a type-safe way.

metadata.title: Work with Arbitrary-Precision Numbers using BigDecimal
metadata.summary: Use BigDecimal for arbitrary-precision decimal arithmetic, avoiding rounding errors and loss of precision in financial or scientific calculations.

metadata.title: Understand that Effects are Lazy Blueprints
metadata.summary: An Effect is a lazy, immutable blueprint describing a computation, which does nothing until it is explicitly executed by a runtime.

metadata.title: Leverage Effect's Built-in Structured Logging
metadata.summary: Use Effect's built-in logging functions (Effect.log, Effect.logInfo, etc.) for structured, configurable, and context-aware logging.

metadata.title: Matching Tagged Unions with matchTag and matchTags
metadata.summary: Use matchTag and matchTags to pattern match on specific tagged union cases, enabling precise and type-safe branching.

metadata.title: Handle API Errors
metadata.summary: Translate application-specific errors from the Effect failure channel into meaningful HTTP error responses.

metadata.title: Representing Time Spans with Duration
metadata.summary: Use the Duration data type to represent time intervals in a type-safe, human-readable, and composable way.

metadata.title: Define Contracts Upfront with Schema
metadata.summary: Use Schema to define the types for your data models and function signatures before writing the implementation, creating clear, type-safe contracts.

metadata.title: Conditionally Branching Workflows
metadata.summary: Use predicate-based operators like Effect.filter and Effect.if to make decisions and control the flow of your application based on runtime values.

metadata.title: Conditional Branching with if, when, and cond
metadata.summary: Use combinators like if, when, and cond to express conditional logic declaratively across Effect, Stream, Option, and Either.

metadata.title: Manage Resources Safely in a Pipeline
metadata.summary: Ensure resources like file handles or connections are safely acquired at the start of a pipeline and always released at the end, even on failure.

metadata.title: Control Flow with Conditional Combinators
metadata.summary: Use combinators like Effect.if, Effect.when, and Effect.cond to handle conditional logic in a declarative, composable way.

metadata.title: Manually Manage Lifecycles with `Scope`
metadata.summary: Use `Scope` directly to manage complex resource lifecycles or when building custom layers.

metadata.title: Run Background Tasks with Effect.fork
metadata.summary: Use Effect.fork to start a computation in a background fiber, allowing the parent fiber to continue its work without waiting.

metadata.title: Transforming Values with map
metadata.summary: Use map to transform the result of an Effect, Stream, Option, or Either in a declarative, type-safe way.

metadata.title: Trace Operations Across Services with Spans
metadata.summary: Use Effect.withSpan to create custom tracing spans, providing detailed visibility into the performance and flow of your application's operations.

metadata.title: Process Streaming Data with Stream
metadata.summary: Use Stream<A, E, R> to represent and process data that arrives over time, such as file reads, WebSocket messages, or paginated API results.

metadata.title: Chaining Computations with flatMap
metadata.summary: Use flatMap to chain together computations where each step may itself be effectful, optional, or error-prone.

metadata.title: Effectful Pattern Matching with matchEffect
metadata.summary: Use matchEffect to perform effectful branching based on success or failure, enabling rich workflows in the Effect world.

metadata.title: Manage Shared State Safely with Ref
metadata.summary: Use Ref<A> to model shared, mutable state in a concurrent environment, ensuring all updates are atomic and free of race conditions.

metadata.title: Filtering Results with filter
metadata.summary: Use filter to keep or discard results based on a predicate, across Effect, Stream, Option, and Either.

metadata.title: Run a Pipeline for its Side Effects
metadata.summary: Execute a pipeline for its effects without collecting the results, saving memory.

metadata.title: Execute Long-Running Apps with Effect.runFork
metadata.summary: Use Effect.runFork at the application's entry point to launch a long-running process as a detached fiber, allowing for graceful shutdown.

metadata.title: Write Tests That Adapt to Application Code
metadata.summary: A cardinal rule of testing: Tests must adapt to the application's interface, not the other way around. Never modify application code solely to make a test pass.

metadata.title: Process collections of data asynchronously
metadata.summary: Process collections of data asynchronously in a lazy, composable, and resource-safe manner using Effect's Stream.

metadata.title: Comparing Data by Value with Data.struct
metadata.summary: Use Data.struct to create immutable, structurally-typed objects that can be compared by value, not by reference.

metadata.title: Run Independent Effects in Parallel with Effect.all
metadata.summary: Use Effect.all to run multiple independent effects concurrently and collect all their results into a single tuple.

metadata.title: Use the Auto-Generated .Default Layer in Tests
metadata.summary: When testing, always use the MyService.Default layer that is automatically generated by the Effect.Service class for dependency injection.

metadata.title: Modeling Validated Domain Types with Brand
metadata.summary: Use Brand to create domain-specific types from primitives, making illegal states unrepresentable and preventing accidental misuse.

metadata.title: Process a Large File with Constant Memory
metadata.summary: Create a data pipeline from a file on disk, processing it line-by-line without loading the entire file into memory.

metadata.title: Implement Graceful Shutdown for Your Application
metadata.summary: Use Effect.runFork and listen for OS signals (SIGINT, SIGTERM) to trigger a Fiber.interrupt, ensuring all resources are safely released.

metadata.title: Parse and Validate Data with Schema.decode
metadata.summary: Use Schema.decode(schema) to create an Effect that parses and validates unknown data, which integrates seamlessly with Effect's error handling.

metadata.title: Understand Layers for Dependency Injection
metadata.summary: A Layer is a blueprint that describes how to build a service, detailing its own requirements and any potential errors during its construction.

metadata.title: Decouple Fibers with Queues and PubSub
metadata.summary: Use Queue for point-to-point work distribution and PubSub for broadcast messaging to enable safe, decoupled communication between concurrent fibers.

metadata.title: Handle Unexpected Errors by Inspecting the Cause
metadata.summary: Use Cause<E> to get rich, structured information about errors and failures, including defects, interruptions, and error traces.

metadata.title: Validating and Parsing Branded Types
metadata.summary: Use Schema and Brand together to validate and parse branded types at runtime, ensuring only valid values are constructed.

metadata.title: Retry Operations Based on Specific Errors
metadata.summary: Use Effect.retry and predicate functions to selectively retry an operation only when specific, recoverable errors occur.

metadata.title: Handling Specific Errors with catchTag and catchTags
metadata.summary: Use catchTag and catchTags to recover from or handle specific error types in the Effect failure channel, enabling precise and type-safe error recovery.

metadata.title: Wrap Asynchronous Computations with tryPromise
metadata.summary: Use Effect.tryPromise to safely convert a function that returns a Promise into an Effect, capturing rejections in the error channel.

metadata.title: Trace Operations Across Services with Spans
metadata.summary: Use Effect.withSpan to create custom tracing spans, providing detailed visibility into the performance and flow of your application's operations.

metadata.title: Collect All Results into a List
metadata.summary: Run a pipeline and gather all of its results into an in-memory array.

metadata.title: Avoid Long Chains of .andThen; Use Generators Instead
metadata.summary: Prefer Effect.gen over long chains of .andThen for sequential logic to improve readability and maintainability.

metadata.title: Handle Flaky Operations with Retries and Timeouts
metadata.summary: Use Effect.retry and Effect.timeout to build resilience against slow or intermittently failing operations, such as network requests.

metadata.title: Write Sequential Code with Effect.gen
metadata.summary: Use Effect.gen with yield* to write sequential, asynchronous code in a style that looks and feels like familiar async/await.

metadata.title: Transform Effect Values with map and flatMap
metadata.summary: Use Effect.map for synchronous transformations and Effect.flatMap to chain operations that return another Effect.

metadata.title: Create a Reusable Runtime from Layers
metadata.summary: Compile your application's layers into a reusable Runtime object to efficiently execute multiple effects that share the same context.

metadata.title: Converting from Nullable, Option, or Either
metadata.summary: Use fromNullable, fromOption, and fromEither to convert nullable values, Option, or Either into Effects or Streams, enabling safe and composable interop.

metadata.title: Distinguish 'Not Found' from Errors
metadata.summary: Use Effect<Option<A>> to clearly distinguish between a recoverable 'not found' case (None) and a true failure (Fail).

metadata.title: Process a Collection in Parallel with Effect.forEach
metadata.summary: Use Effect.forEach with the `concurrency` option to process a collection of items in parallel with a fixed limit, preventing resource exhaustion.

metadata.title: Model Validated Domain Types with Brand
metadata.summary: Use Brand to turn primitive types like string or number into specific, validated domain types like Email or PositiveInt, making illegal states unrepresentable.

metadata.title: Create Pre-resolved Effects with succeed and fail
metadata.summary: Use Effect.succeed(value) to create an Effect that immediately succeeds with a value, and Effect.fail(error) for an Effect that immediately fails.

metadata.title: Type Classes for Equality, Ordering, and Hashing with Data.Class
metadata.summary: Use Data.Class to derive and implement type classes for equality, ordering, and hashing, enabling composable and type-safe abstractions.

metadata.title: Mocking Dependencies in Tests
metadata.summary: Use a test-specific Layer to provide mock implementations of services your code depends on, enabling isolated and deterministic unit tests.

metadata.title: Wrapping Synchronous and Asynchronous Computations
metadata.summary: Use try and tryPromise to safely wrap synchronous or asynchronous computations that may throw or reject, capturing errors in the Effect world.

metadata.title: Create a Service Layer from a Managed Resource
metadata.summary: Use `Layer.scoped` with `Effect.Service` to transform a managed resource into a shareable, application-wide service.

metadata.title: Define a Type-Safe Configuration Schema
metadata.summary: Use Effect.Config primitives to define a schema for your application's configuration, ensuring type-safety and separation from code.

metadata.title: Set Up a New Effect Project
metadata.summary: Initialize a new Node.js project with the necessary TypeScript configuration and Effect dependencies to start building.

metadata.title: Solve Promise Problems with Effect
metadata.summary: Understand how Effect solves the fundamental problems of native Promises, such as untyped errors, lack of dependency injection, and no built-in cancellation.

metadata.title: Build a Basic HTTP Server
metadata.summary: Combine Layer, Runtime, and Effect to create a simple, robust HTTP server using Node.js's built-in http module.

metadata.title: Creating from Collections
metadata.summary: Use fromIterable and fromArray to create Streams or Effects from arrays, iterables, or other collections, enabling batch and streaming operations.

metadata.title: Poll for Status Until a Task Completes
metadata.summary: Use Effect.race to run a repeating polling effect alongside a main task, automatically stopping the polling when the main task finishes.

metadata.title: Matching on Success and Failure with match
metadata.summary: Use match to handle both success and failure cases in a single, declarative place for Effect, Option, and Either.

metadata.title: Model Dependencies as Services
metadata.summary: Abstract external dependencies and capabilities into swappable, testable services using Effect's dependency injection system.

metadata.title: Use Chunk for High-Performance Collections
metadata.summary: Use Chunk<A> as a high-performance, immutable alternative to JavaScript's Array, especially for data processing pipelines.

metadata.title: Compose Resource Lifecycles with `Layer.merge`
metadata.summary: Combine multiple resource-managing layers, letting Effect automatically handle the acquisition and release order.

metadata.title: Working with Tuples using Data.tuple
metadata.summary: Use Data.tuple to create immutable, type-safe tuples that support value-based equality and pattern matching.

metadata.title: Modeling Tagged Unions with Data.case
metadata.summary: Use Data.case to create tagged unions (algebraic data types) for robust, type-safe domain modeling and pattern matching.

metadata.title: Beyond the Date Type - Real World Dates, Times, and Timezones
metadata.summary: Use the Clock service for testable access to the current time and prefer immutable primitives for storing and passing timestamps.

metadata.title: Integrate Effect Tracing with OpenTelemetry
metadata.summary: Connect Effect's tracing spans to OpenTelemetry for end-to-end distributed tracing and visualization.

metadata.title: Lifting Errors and Absence with fail, none, and left
metadata.summary: Use fail, none, and left to represent errors or absence in Effect, Option, or Either, making failures explicit and type-safe.

metadata.title: Extract Path Parameters
metadata.summary: Capture and use dynamic segments from a request URL, such as a resource ID.

metadata.title: Create a Managed Runtime for Scoped Resources
metadata.summary: Use Layer.launch to safely manage the lifecycle of layers containing scoped resources, ensuring finalizers are always run.

metadata.title: Make an Outgoing HTTP Client Request
metadata.summary: Use the built-in Effect HTTP client to make safe and composable requests to external services from within your API.

metadata.title: Wrap Synchronous Computations with sync and try
metadata.summary: Use Effect.sync for non-throwing synchronous code and Effect.try for synchronous code that might throw an exception.

metadata.title: Accumulate Multiple Errors with Either
metadata.summary: Use Either<E, A> to represent computations that can fail, allowing you to accumulate multiple errors instead of short-circuiting on the first one.

metadata.title: Understand Fibers as Lightweight Threads
metadata.summary: A Fiber is a lightweight, virtual thread managed by the Effect runtime, enabling massive concurrency on a single OS thread without the overhead of traditional threading.

metadata.title: Mapping and Chaining over Collections with forEach and all
metadata.summary: Use forEach and all to apply effectful functions to collections and combine the results, enabling batch and parallel processing.

metadata.title: Create a Testable HTTP Client Service
metadata.summary: Define an HttpClient service with separate 'Live' and 'Test' layers to enable robust, testable interactions with external APIs.

metadata.title: Use .pipe for Composition
metadata.summary: Use the .pipe() method to chain multiple operations onto an Effect in a readable, top-to-bottom sequence.

metadata.title: Checking Option and Either Cases
metadata.summary: Use isSome, isNone, isLeft, and isRight to check Option and Either cases for simple, type-safe branching.

metadata.title: Create a Basic HTTP Server
metadata.summary: Launch a simple, effect-native HTTP server to respond to incoming requests.

metadata.title: Automatically Retry Failed Operations
metadata.summary: Build a self-healing pipeline that can automatically retry failed processing steps using a configurable backoff strategy.

metadata.title: Understand the Three Effect Channels (A, E, R)
metadata.summary: Learn about the three generic parameters of an Effect: the success value (A), the failure error (E), and the context requirements (R).

metadata.title: Provide Configuration to Your App via a Layer
metadata.summary: Use Config.layer(schema) to create a Layer that provides your configuration schema to the application's context.

metadata.title: Work with Dates and Times using DateTime
metadata.summary: Use DateTime for immutable, time-zone-aware date and time values, enabling safe and precise time calculations.

metadata.title: Working with Immutable Arrays using Data.array
metadata.summary: Use Data.array to create immutable, type-safe arrays that support value-based equality and safe functional operations.

metadata.title: Manage Shared State Safely with Ref
metadata.summary: Use Ref<A> to model shared, mutable state in a concurrent environment, ensuring all updates are atomic and free of race conditions.
